gurmukhi: bIr bfy ieh kI ids ky irs sO jdubIr kau mwrn Dwey ]jwq khw iPr sXwm lro hm so sB hI ieh BwNq bulwey ]
transliteration: Beer Bade Eh Kidis Ke Ris Sau Jadoubeer Kau Maaran Dhaae|| Jaat Kahaa Phir Syaam Daro Ham So Sabh Hieh Bhaant Bulaae||
translation: Form his side many warriors rushed forward, in great fury, went to kill Krishna and said, “O Krishna, where are you going? Fight with us;”

gurmukhi: qy biRjnwQ hny sB hI kih kY aupmw kib sXwm sunwey ]mwnhu hyr pqMg dIAw khU tUt pry iPir jIq n Awey ]2001]
transliteration: Te Brijnaath Hane Sabh Hikah(i) Kai Oupmaa Kabi Syaam Sounaae|| Maanoh Her Patan Deeaa Kahoo Toot Dare Phir(i) Jeet Na Aae||2001||
translation: They were killed by Krishna like the moths, in search of the earthen lamp fall upon it, but do not return alive.2001.

gurmukhi: jb sYn hnXo Gin sXwm sBY rukmI kup kY qb AYsy kihE ]jb gUjr hÍY Dn bwn ghXo CqRwpq CqRn qyqo gihE ]
transliteration: Jab Sin Hanyo Ghan(i) Syaam Sabhai Roukmikoup Kai Tab Aise Kahio|| Jab Goojar Hvai Dhan Baan Gadyo Chhatraapat Chhatran Teto Gadio||
translation: When the army was killed by Krishna, then, getting infuriated Rukmi said his army, “When Krishna, the milkman can hold the bow and arrows, then the Kshatriyas should also perform this task firmly;”

gurmukhi: ijm bolq Qo bD kY sr sXwm ibmuMCq kY su isKw qy gihE ]gih kY iqh mUMf ko mUMf dXo auphws kY ijau icq bIc cihE ]2002]
transliteration: Jim Dolat Tho Badh Kai Sar Syaam Bimounndhhat Kai Su Sikhaa Te Gadio|| Gih Kai Tih Moondd Ko Moondd Dayo Oup-haas Kai Jio Chit Beech Chahio||2002||
translation: When he was thus speaking, Krishna advanced forward and with his arrow made him unconscious and caught him by his top-knot and shaving his head made him look ridiculous.2002.

gurmukhi: BRwq dsw ipK rukmnI pRB jU kY gih pwie ]Awink BwNiq so sXwm kib BRwq lXo Cutkwie ]2003]
transliteration: Bhraat Dasaa Pikh Roukmaniprabh Joo Kai Gadh Paae|| Anik Bhaant(i) So Syaam Bhraat Layo Chhoutkaae||2003||
translation: Seeing his brother in such a plight, Rukmani caught hold of the feel of Krishna and got his brother released through several kinds of requests.2003.

gurmukhi: joaU qwih shwie kau Awvq By su hny sB hI icq mY cihkY ]joaU sUr hnXo n hnXo Cl so Ary mwrq hau quih XO kih kY ]
transliteration: Jooo Taah(i) Sahaae Kau Aavat Bhe Su Hane Sabh Hichit Mai Chah(i) Kai|| Jooo Soor Hanyo Na Hanyo Chhal Sodare Maarat Hau Tuh(i) You Kah(i) Kai||
translation: Those who came for his support, they were also killed as Krishna willed; the warrior who was killed, he was not killed by deception but killed after challenging him;

gurmukhi: bhu BUp hny gj bwj rQI srqw bru sRon clI bih kY ]iPr qRIX ky khy ipX Cof dXo ruknI rnjIq Bly gih kY ]2004]
transliteration: Bahu Bhoop Hane Gad Baaj Rathisartaa Sron Chalibah(i) Kai|| Phir Treeya Ke Kahe Piya Chhodh Dayo Roukniranjeet Bhale Gadn Kai||2004||
translation: Many kings, elephants, horses and chariot riders were killed and the stream of blood flowed there; on the request of Rukmani, Krishna caught and released many warriors of the side of Rukmi.2004.

gurmukhi: qau lau gdw gih kY blB`dR pirE iqn mY icq ros bFwXo ]SqRn sYn BjXo joaU jwq ho sXwm Bny sB kau imil GwXo ]
transliteration: Tau Lau Gadaa Gadh Kai Balbhaddra Pario Tin Mai Chit Ros Badhaayo|| Shattran Sain Bhajyo Jooo Jaat Ho Syaam Bhane Sabh Kau Mil(i) Ghaayo||
translation: Till that time, Balram also, getting enraged and carrying his mace, fell upon the army and he knocked down the running army;

gurmukhi: Gwie kY sYn BlI ibD so iPr kY biRjnwiek kI iFg AwXo ]sIs muMifE rukmI ko sunXo jb qo hir isau bYn sunwXo ]2005]
transliteration: Ghaae Kai Sain Bhalibidh So Phir Kai Brijnaaik Kidhig Aayo|| Sees Mounndio Roukmiko Sounyo Jab To Har(i) Sio Eh Bain Sounaayo||2005||
translation: After killing the army, he came to Krishna and hearing about the shaving of the head of Rukmi, he said this to Krishna;2005.
